data.name: EditElementForm.Fields.Collapsable.LearningContent.Text
data.value: Choose a external learning material (file or link)*

data.name: EditElementForm.AdaptivityContent.Dialog.Title
data.value: Edit tasks of the adaptivity element

data.name: EditElementForm.Fields.Collapsable.LearningContent.PrimitiveH5P.Info.Text
data.value:
H5P files are a container format for building multimedia learning content. They can be used to create a variety of types of learning content, such as quizzes, word search games or collections of terms.

As so many different types of content can be created with H5P files, it is necessary to classify them in the authoring tool:

  • If it is a H5P element that can be completed (correctly or incorrectly), such as a quiz or video, you should not check this box.
  • However, if it is a H5P element that cannot be completed, such as a collection of terms, you should check this box so that students can still complete this item by simply opening it and receive points for editing.

If you are not sure which category an H5P file belongs in, then it is better to check this box. This will allow students to edit the content and still definitely keep playing your world.

For more information on H5P files, please read the user documentation of the authoring tool.

data.name: EditStoryElementForm.Fields.Collapsable.StoryText.Text
data.value: Story of this story element. Each text block can contain 400 characters

data.name: EditElementForm.Story.Tooltip
data.value:
The text that you formulate within a text block for your story is displayed to the students on a slide in the subsequent 3D learning environment.

If you add another text block with new content to your story, this text block will be displayed in a subsequent slide in the 3D learning environment.

For example, if you use three text blocks within a story element, the text contained therein will be displayed to the students in the 3D learning environment in three consecutive slides.

data.name: EditElementForm.Tooltip.ExplanationLearningElement
data.value:
Learning elements
Learning elements can be used to provide external learning material such as H5Ps, videos, images or texts in a learning space.

data.name: EditElementForm.Tooltip.ExplanationAdaptivityElement
data.value:
Adaptivity elements
With the help of adaptivity elements, multiple and single-choice questions with different levels of difficulty can be provided in a learning space.

data.name: EditElementForm.Tooltip.ExplanationLearnAdaptElementPart1
data.value: Created learning elements and adaptivity elements can be positioned in different slots within a floor plan of the learning space.

data.name: EditElementForm.Tooltip.ExplanationLearnAdaptElementPart2
data.value: Depending on the selected shape of the floor plan, the number of slots available within the floor plan for the placement of learning elements and adaptivity elements differs.

data.name: EditElementForm.Tooltip.ExplanationStoryElement
data.value:
Story elements
Story elements can be used to tell a story about your learning world.

A total of two-story elements can be created within a learning space, one story element each for entering and leaving a learning space.

The corresponding slots can be found in each floor plan at the position of the entrance and exit doors.

data.name: EditElementForm.Tooltip.Image.Alt
data.value: Example image for slots in a learning space floor plan
